definition: Metallic elements with partially filled d-orbitals that exhibit variable oxidation states and form colored compounds.

positive_examples: The steel beam contains iron and chromium for strength and corrosion resistance.
Copper wiring conducts electricity efficiently throughout the building.
The catalyst uses platinum to speed up the chemical reaction.
Titanium implants are biocompatible and lightweight for medical use.
Nickel plating gives the surface a shiny, protective coating.
Manganese is added to steel to improve its hardness and durability.
negative_examples: Aluminum foil wraps the sandwich to keep it fresh.
The sodium chloride dissolved completely in water.
Carbon forms the backbone of all organic molecules.
Helium gas filled the birthday balloons.
Silicon chips power modern electronic devices.
Sulfur crystals formed yellow deposits near the volcano.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: AlkaliMetals, NobleGases, Halogens, AlkalineEarthMetals
